meanings.definition: A type of food made from roasted and ground maize or sorghum.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious bowl of tsamba for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The villagers gathered around the fire to cook tsamba for the feast.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's secret recipe for tsamba always brings the family together.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly roasted tsamba filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The children eagerly helped prepare the tsamba for the celebration.

meanings.definition: To grind or crush into a fine powder.
meanings.sent1: She used a mortar and pestle to tsamba the spices for the curry.
meanings.sent2: The miller carefully tsambaed the grains to make flour.
meanings.sent3: I need to tsamba these herbs to make a fragrant seasoning.
meanings.sent4: The chef will tsamba the nuts to sprinkle on top of the dessert.
meanings.sent5: The old stone grinder was used to tsamba the coffee beans.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional dish in Malawi and Zambia.
meanings.sent1: The family shared a hearty meal of tsamba around the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of the simmering tsamba filled the air.
meanings.sent3: The festival featured a cooking competition for the best tsamba dish.
meanings.sent4: The elders passed down the recipe for the special tsamba dish.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling fresh tsamba.
